    Update Notes for Splice Machine Version 2.6

    This topic describes significant updates in this release and recent, previous releases of Splice Machine.

    • General Notes includes notes that apply to all Splice Machine releases.
    • Updates in This Version includes notes about new updates in this release.
    • Updates in Previous Versions summarizes updates in all recent releases of Splice Machine prior to this release.
    For information about workaround for problems that will be fixed in a future release, or notes about previously unstated limitations, see the Release Notes for Splice Machine Version 2.5.

    The ReadMe file included with the Splice Machine installers contains a list of specific bug fixes in this release.

    General Notes

    This section contains general update notes.

    Updated Requirements

    You should review our latest requirements whenever installing a new version of Splice Machine:

    Latest Requirements

    Requirements are frequently updated, as we add compatibility with new releases of Hadoop and related software.

    Please see the Splice Machine Requirements page in our Splice Machine Getting Started Guide for the latest platform compatibility and requirements information. The same information is also repeated in each of our Installation Guides.

    Updates in This Version

    This section summarizes significant updates to the Splice Machine software and documentation since the previous release, which was version 2.5. This section includes the following sections:

    • Performance Enhancements
    • New and Updated Features
    • Deprecated Features
    • Documentation Updates

    Performance Enhancements

    This release features a number of significant performance improvements:

    Version Enhancement
    2.5
    • New product offering: Splice Machine Database-as-a-Service (DBaaS)!
    • Performance enhancements on TPCC and TPCH benchmarks.
    • Greatly improved data importation performance.
    • The ability to tell Splice Machine to pin (cache) a table in memory to allow rapid access for analytical tasks.
    • Performance enhancements to our JDBC and ODBC drivers.
    • Several of the window functions have been revised for better performance.

    New and Updated Features

    This section summarizes important feature updates that have been made to the current release (Product Release Version 2.6) of Splice Machine since release 2.5.

    Version Updated Change Description
    2.6.1 DBaaS Our new Database-as-a-Service offering is now available.
    2.6.1 Estimated Statistics You can now optionally reduce the time required to generate statistics for a table by specifying a sampling percentage in the analyze command; Splice Machine will then generate statistics by sampling that percentage of the table, instead of analyzing the entire table.
    2.6 HAProxy

    HAProxy is an open source utility that is available on most Linux distributions and cloud platforms for load-balancing TCP and HTTP requests. Users can leverage this tool to distribute incoming client requests among the region server nodes on which Splice Machine instances are running.

    Our Configuring HAProxy topic walks you through configuring HAProxy on a non-Splice Machine cluster node, and how to use HAProxy with Splice Machine on a Kerberos-enabled cluster.
    2.5 BULK_IMPORT_HFILE

    We have added a new system procedure for rapidly importing data:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.BULK_IMPORT_HFILE

    This procedure creates HFiles directly, rather than using HBase APIs; it is faster than our IMPORT_DATA procedure, but has some limitations:

    • To use it, you must already know how you want your data split across regions (your data's split points).

    • HFile import does not enforce any constraints, including unique, foreign key, or primary key constraints.
    2.5 DBaaS Our new Database-as-a-Service offering is now available.
    2.5 Backup and Restore

    The ability to incrementally back up and restore your database is now available to Splice Machine Enterprise Edition users.

    For more information, see Backing Up and Restoring Your Database in our Administrator's Guide, and the following built-in system procedures and system tables in our SQL Reference Manual:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CANCEL_BACKUP
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CANCEL_DAILY_BACKUP
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DELETE_BACKUP
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DELETE_OLD_BACKUPS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESTORE_DATABASE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SCHEDULE_DAILY_BACKUP
    • SYSBACKUP System Table
    • SYSBACKUPITEMS System Table
    • SYSBACKUPJOBS System Table
    2.5 External Tables

    You can now access ORC and PARQUET files as external tables. See Using External Tables in our Developer's Guide for more information.

    The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REFRESH_EXTERNAL_TABLE built-in system procedure are now available for working with external tables.
    2.5 Migration Assistant Tool

    The Migration Assistant tool was created by Splice Machine to help migrate your database to a new version of the Splice Machine software. You run it before upgrading your software to export your database to file, and then run it after upgrading your software to import an upgraded version of your database.
    2.5 Pinned Tables
    (RDD Caching)

    You can now use the UNPIN TABLE statement to delete the cached version of the table.

    You also need to use the new pin query optimization hint, which is described in our Query Optimization topic.
    2.5 Schema-level Privileges Updates to the Revoke statements allow you to define privileges at the schema level.
    2.5 Updated Connectors

    Splice Machine has added enhancements to our JDBC and ODBC drivers for improved performance and added features.

    Due to these changes, you must use the Splice Machine JDBC and ODBC drivers; other drivers will not work properly.
    2.5 Updated Statistics

    Splice Machine has enhanced our statistics collection methods, taking advantage of advanced features provided by the Yahoo DataSketches library. As a result, these procedures and tables have been deprecated:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COLLECT_TABLE_STATISTICS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_TABLE_STATISTICS
    • SYSSTATISTICS table

    Deprecated Features

    Version when deprecated Change Description
    2.5 Statistics Built-in Procedures

    The following built-in system procedures are no longer available:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COLLECT_TABLE_STATISTICS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_TABLE_STATISTICS

    Note that:

    • You can continue to use the ANALYZE command line command to collect statistics for a specific table.
    • You can call the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COLLECT_SCHEMA_STATISTICS built-in system procedure to collect statistics on a schema, including statistics for every table in the schema.
    2.5 Statistics Tables

    The following system tables are no longer available:

    • SYSSTATISTICS
    • SYSOPERATIONHISTORY
    • SYSSTATEMENTHISTORY
    • SYSSTATISTICS
    • SYSTASKHISTORY

    Documentation Updates

    This section summarizes important documentation updates in this version:

    Version Change Description
    2.6 Error Codes Documented Our SQL Reference Manual now has a section that contains descriptions of all error codes.
    2.5 Appearance The appearance of the documentation has been altered: we are now using a left-sided navigation pane, and some of our appearance styles have been altered to more closely match the appearance of the splicemachine.com web.
    2.5 Content Organization

    The organization of the docs has been altered:

    • The top-level contents has changed:
      • The splice> Command Line Reference manual is now a top-level section, rather than being part of the Developer's Guide.
      • The Developer's Guide has been reorganized.
      • The user interface for our Database-as-a-Service is documented in the top-level Database-as-a-Service Only section.
      • The Administrator's Guide and Installation Guide are now part of the top-level On-Premise Only section.
    • Content previously included in our Getting Started Guide has been moved to the Notes section.

     
    2.5 Tutorials

    We've added a number of tutorials to the documentation, a number of which have been migrated from our Community site.

    You can find a list of available tutorials here.

    Our navigation menu prefaces the title of each tutorial with an asterisk (*).
    2.5 Updates

    All enhancements and bug fixes have been documented, as have all new features.

    Updates in Previous Versions

    This section summarizes significant updates to the Splice Machine software and documentation in previous releases. It includes the following sections:

    • Performance Enhancements
    • New and Updated Features
    • Deprecated Functions
    • Documentation Updates

    Performance Enhancements

    The following table summarizes notable performance enhancement updates in recent releases:

    Version Enhancement
    2.0
    • Added Spark engine for unprecedented performance enhancements.
    1.50
    • Enhanced use of statistics to improve query plan generation.
    1.50
    • Improved logic instituted for flattening subqueries.
    Note that every Splice Machine release includes numerous "under the covers" performance enhancements, in addition to those listed in the table above.

    New and Updated Features

    The following table summarizes important feature updates that have been completed in recent releases.

    Version Updated Change Description
    2.0 Added functions The IDENTITY_VAL_LOCAL function is now available in Splice Machine.
    2.0 Common Table Expressions Common table expressions, also known as the WITH clause or the subquery factoring clause, are now available in Splice Machine.
    2.0 Data Import changes

    Our data import technology was modified for improved performance and error handling. The number of parameters and the meaning of certain parameters changed for these built-in system procedures:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.IMPORT_DATA
    • SYSCS_UTIL.UPSERT_DATA_FROM_FILE
    2.0 Timestamps in imported data

    Previous versions of Splice Machine were "lenient" with regard to parsing timestamps when importing data:

    • Timestamp data in imported columns must now match the formatting pattern you specify in the IMPORT or UPSERT call.
    • All timestamp values in a file being imported must now use the same timestamp format; multiple timestamp formats in a file are no longer supported.
    • Splice Machine now uses only one default pattern: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss, which specifies a 24-hour clock and no fractions of seconds.
    2.0 ODBC Driver The new and improved Using the Splice Machine ODBC Driver driver is now available.
    2.0 Schema owner

    The owner of a schema can now be changed by the current schema owner:

      SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_SCHEMA_OWNER
    2.0 Spark engine

    As described in the Performance Enhancements section above, we now use Spark for greatly improved query execution performance for analytical queries.
    2.0 Temporary Tables The previous restrictions on data types allowed in temporary tables have been removed: you can now use all data types in temporary tables.
    1.5.5 Cloudera release compatibility Splice Machine now works with Cloudera 5.4.10, in addition to earlier versions of Cloudera, as noted in our Splice Machine Requirements page.
    1.54 Import Logging

    When you enable import logging by setting the property splice.import.enableStatusLogging to TRUE, you can view the logged information in two ways:

    • In the region server logs
    • In the summary file (this is new) that is created in the /BAD directory that you specified in your call to SYSCS_UTIL.IMPORT_DATA call.
    1.53 Cloudera release compatibility

    Splice Machine now works with Cloudera 5.4.8, in addition to earlier versions of Cloudera, as noted in our Splice Machine Requirementspage.
    1.51 Synonyms

    The following SQL statements are now available:

    • CREATE SYNONYM
    • DROP SYNONYM
    1.50 Auto Trace

    The auto trace feature was previously on by default; it has been changed to be off by default. You can turn it on using the Auto Trace built-in system procedure.
    1.50 Date Arithmetic

    A number of new date functions have been added to enhance our compatibility with third party Business Intelligence tools. There's A new topic in the Developer's Guide: Working With Dates.

    We have added these new built-in SQL date and date arithmetic functions:

    • EXTRACT
    • MONTHNAME
    • NOW
    • QUARTER
    • ROWID
    • WEEK

    The SECOND function has been updated to work properly with timestamp values.

    And there's a significantly updated version of the TRUNC or TRUNCATE function that now works with date values. As a result, the TRUNC_DATE function has been deprecated.
    1.50 DBeaver SQL Client We have added instructions for installing and Using DBeaver with Splice Machine.
    1.50 Foreign Keys

    Foreign keys are now operational. There's a new topic in the Developer's Guide: Foreign Keys and Referential Integrity.

    And there are updates for foreign keys in these SQL statements:

    • ALTER TABLE
    • CONSTRAINT
    • CREATE TABLE
    1.50 Incremental backup

    Both full and incremental backups are now supported. There's a new topic Backing Up and Restoring Databases topic in the Maintaining section of this Guide.

    We've made major updates to these functions, including the ability to backup to and restore from cloud services such as AWS:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESTORE_DATABASE

    And we've added these new system procedures:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CANCEL_DAILY_BACKUP
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DELETE_BACKUP
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DELETE_OLD_BACKUPS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SCHEDULE_DAILY_BACKUP

    Finally, there are now several system tables that store information about backups:

    • SYSBACKUP System Table
    • SYSBACKUPITEMS System Table
    • SYSBACKUPJOBS System Table
    1.50 Importing Data

    There's now a how-to overview topic about Importing Data in this Guide. There are a number of updates and improvements:

    • The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_DATA system procedure, which was available in earlier versions of Splice Machine, has been deprecated, and is replaced by the SYSCS_UTIL.IMPORT_DATA system procedure.
    • SYSCS_UTIL.IMPORT_DATA features new improvements, especially in error checking.
    1.50 Limit clause Splice Machine now supports the LIMIT n clause in Select expressions, which you can use to limit the results of a query to a specific range of results.
    1.50 Regular expression matches We have added the REGEXP_LIKE Operator, which is similar to the LIKE operator, except that it allows you to specify a full regular expression pattern match.
    1.50 Running splice> from a file

    You can invoke the splice> command line interpreter to run a set of SQL commands from a file and then exit, using the new -f argument.

    For more information, see the Command Line (splice>) Reference
    1.50 Savepoints

    Transaction savepoints have been added. There's a brief description of savepoints in the Running Transactions In Splice Machine topic in the Developer's Guide.

    There are also three new statements that are documented in the splice>Command Line Reference

    • Savepoint Command
    • Release Savepoint Command
    • Rollback to Savepoint Command
    1.50 Statistics

    Statistics collection has been added to Splice Machine, for enhanced query optimization. The Using Statistics with Splice Machine topic in the Performance Tuning section introduces you to the functions and tables you can use to work with statistics for your database. And the SQL Reference Manual includes these reference topics:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.COLLECT_SCHEMA_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
    • SYSCS_UTIL.COLLECT_TABLE_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
    • SYSCS_UTIL.DISABLE_COLUMN_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
    • SYSCS_UTIL.DROP_SCHEMA_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
    • SYSCS_UTIL.DROP_TABLE_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
    • SYSCS_UTIL.ENABLE_COLUMN_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
    • SYSCOLUMNSTATISTICS System Table
    • SYSTABLESTATISTICS System Table
    1.50 Temporary Tables

    Temporary tables have been updated for compatibility with Business Intelligence tools, and there's a new how-to overview topic Using Temporary Database Tables in the Developer's Guide:

    • The CREATE TEMPORARY TABLEstatement has been added.
    • There are important updates to the DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement.
    1.50 Top clause Splice Machine now supports the TOP n clause in Select expressions, which you can use to limit the results of a query.
    1.50 Triggers

    Triggers are now operational. There's a new topic in the Developer's Guide: Using Database Triggers.

    And there are updates for triggers in these SQL Reference Manual topics:

    • CREATE TRIGGER statement
    • DROP TRIGGER statement
    • UPDATE statement
    • WHERE clause
    1.50 Window Functions

    We've added four new window functions: 

    • FIRST_VALUE function
    • LAG function
    • LAST_VALUE function
    • LEAD function

    Deprecated Functions

    This section summarizes any functions or features that have been deprecated in this release.

     

    Version when deprecated Change Description
    2.0 Bit Data Types Documentation has been removed for unsupported data types CHAR FOR BIT DATA, VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA, and LONG VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA.
    2.0 Explain Trace

    The Splice Machine Explain Trace tool, the explaintrace command line command, and the system procedures associated with Explain Trace have been deprecated and are no longer available.

    The Splice Machine Management Console Guide provides an enhanced facility for tracing query execution.
    2.0 Incremental backup Our backup and restore system is currently supporting only full backups. Incremental backups will become available in a future release.
    2.0 Standalone Version on PCs

    The standalone version of Splice Machine no longer works on Windows computers running Cygwin.

    You can use the standalone version on Linux and MacOS computers.
    2.0 Built-in System Procedures

    The following built-in system procedures have been deprecated and are no longer available:

    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_GLOBAL_MAX_TASKS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_MAX_TASKS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_PAST_STATEMENT_SUMMARY
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_REGION_SERVER_TASK_INFO
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_STATEMENT_SUMMARY
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_WRITE_PIPELINE_INFO
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_WRITE_POOL
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_XPLAIN_STATEMENTID
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_XPLAIN_TRACE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_USER_ACCESS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_KILL_STATEMENT
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_PURGE_XPLAIN_TRACE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RELOAD_SECURITY_POLICY
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_AUTO_TRACE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_USER_ACCESS
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_WRITE_POOL
    • SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_XPLAIN_TRACE
    • SYSCS_UTIL.IMPORT_CHECK_DATA
    • SYSCS_UTIL.UPSERT_CHECK_DATA_FROM_FILE
    1.50 SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_DATA system procedure The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_DATA system procedure, which was available in earlier versions of Splice Machine, has been replaced by the SYSCS_UTIL.IMPORT_DATA system procedure
    1.50 TRUNC_DATE built-in function

    Deprecated: use the TRUNCATE function instead to truncate dates.

    Documentation Updates

    This section summarizes important documentation updates completed since version 1.0. Note that, in addition to the changes listed in this table, the documentation is always updated for the new and modified features described in earlier sections of this topic.

    Please visit our Documentation Summary page for more information about the organization of our documentation, and how to take advantage of its available navigation features.
    Version when updated Change Description
    2.0 Set Operators The Set operators Clauses section of the SQL Reference Manual.
    2.0 Splice Machine Installation Guide The Installation Guide has been rewritten and simplified into a small number of pages. This is now a chapter in this book.
    2.0 Spark

    We've added documentation for our Spark engine:

    • Using Spark Libraries with Splice Machine in our Developer's Guide provides an example, in Java, of using the Spark Machine Learning Library with Splice Machine.
    2.0 Management Console The new Splice Machine Management Console book describes our real-time monitoring interface for Spark queries.
    1.55 Updating System Procedures The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UPDATE_ALL_SYSTEM_PROCEDURES built-in system procedure is now documented.
    1.5.2 Added RLwrap Info Splice Machine recommends using the RLwrap command line wrapper, with our splice> command line interpreter. We've added a new topic that describes some of the rlWrap Commands Synopsis that you might find useful.
    1.5.2 Examples We've updated many of the examples used in our SQL Reference Manual to use a simple database of two fictionalized American Major League baseball teams, and have included the database in this documentation suite.
    1.5.2 Reorganized table of contents

    The tables of contents in our Developer's Guide and SQL Reference Manual each have been updated with an extra level of hierarchy, which simplifies finding topics by specific category, and greatly simplifies the context-sensitive menu tree in our web-based documentation system.

    In addition, to improve screen readability, we've shortened the names shown in the table of contents for the Built-in System Procedures section of the SQL Reference Manual by eliminating the schema name prefix in the table of contents. For example, the SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_LOGGERS function is still documented with its full name, but its name is abbreviated in the table of contents (and context-sensitive side menu) to GET_LOGGERS.
    1.5.2 Stylistic changes We've made improvements to our stylesheet, including one update that improves the appearance and wrapping behavior of code snippets in our books.
    1.51 Documentation Reorganization The organization of our documentation was overhauled for this release to simplify navigation.
    1.50 Command Lines Reference

    Usage information for the splice> Commands Reference, including reference information for using each command has been moved from the Splice Machine Getting Started Guide to our Splice Machine Developer's Guide.

    TheSplice Machine Getting Started Guide now contains a brief overview and summary of the splice> commands.
    1.50 Glossary We've added a Glossary.
    1.50 Explain Plan

    The About Explain Plan topic has been greatly enhanced, and now includes a number of examples;this topic has also now been separated out from the Explain Trace topic.

    Use Explain Plan to view the execution plan for a query without actually running it, and use Explain Trace to analyze the execution of statement(s) that have already run.
    1.50 Installation Guide

    The Splice Machine Installation Guide was revamped to make it much simpler to follow: instead of combining the instructions for all platforms together, we have created separate installation guides for each platform on which Splice Machine is supported.

    We've clarified requirements, removed extraneous information, and simplified the installation flow.
    1.50 Logging information All information about using logging in Splice Machine has been moved into the Splice Machine Logging topic in the Configuring section, including new information about manually enabling SQL statement logging.
    1.50 New and updated features

    Documentation has been added for all new and updated features noted in the sections above, including new topic pages in the Getting Started Guide and Developer's Guide to help you understand and use these features.
    1.50 Overview section A Technical Introduction to Splice Machine in the Getting Started Guide has been rewritten to include more useful information to help new developers understand the scope of features available in Splice Machine.
    1.50 Release Notes We've added a Release Notes section in this guide that documents any known workarounds or important notes about specific features.
